docs.snippet: ROME, Oct. 19 (AP).--Foreign Minister Dino Grandi cabled to Secretary of State Henry L. Stimson today that the death of Thomas A. Edison had occasioned "particularly deep sorrow in the Italian nation." His cablegram said:
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, Oct. 19 (AP).--Foreign Minister Dino Grandi cabled to Secretary of State Henry L. Stimson today that the death of Thomas A. Edison had occasioned "particularly deep sorrow in the Italian nation." His cablegram said:

headline.main: DEATH OF EDISON CALLED WORLD LOSS; Statesmen and Press of Many Nations Voice Sorrow Over Inventor's Passing. MUSSOLINI CABLES WIDOW Grandi Also Sends Condolences-- Masaryk Lauds Inventor as Torchbearer of Mankind. President Masaryk's Message. Tributes in German Press. Uruguay Sends Condolences. Austrian Press Pays Tribute. Cuban Senate Votes Condolence.
